exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with still, any more/any longer, or no longer.

items.prompt: Complete with STILL: It's midnight and Ava is ____ at the office.
Complete with STILL: I ____ don't understand this rule.
Complete with STILL: Are you ____ working on the report?
Complete with STILL: We are ____ waiting for the reply.
Complete with STILL: He was ____ sleeping when I left.
Complete with ANY MORE: I don't watch that channel ____.
Complete with ANY LONGER: We don't talk to them ____.
Complete with ANY MORE: This shop isn't open late ____.
Complete with ANY LONGER: He can't stay awake ____.
Complete with NO LONGER: She ____ lives in Kyiv.
Complete with NO LONGER: They ____ sell tickets at the door.
Complete with STILL: Even after the apology, she is ____ angry.

exercises.instruction: Put in still to show that the situation continues.

items.prompt: Complete with STILL: The kids are ____ asleep.
Complete with STILL: It is ____ raining.
Complete with STILL: I have ____ not decided.
Complete with STILL: She ____ hasn't replied.
Complete with STILL: They are ____ fixing the road.
Complete with STILL: I'm ____ thinking about your idea.
Complete with STILL: The plane is ____ waiting to take off.

exercises.instruction: Complete each sentence with still, yet, already, any more/any longer, or no longer.

items.prompt: Choose the word: I haven't finished ____.
Choose the word: Have you paid ____?
Choose the word: I've ____ eaten.
Choose the word: She's ____ left.
Choose the word: He is ____ unemployed.
Choose the word: I don't feel hungry ____.
Choose the word: Do you ____ live there?
Choose the word: They aren't friends ____.
Choose the word: Is dinner ready ____?
Choose the word: We ____ haven't met your brother.
Choose the word: I'm ____ waiting for a call.
Choose the word: He ____ works here.
Choose the word: Are you ____ here?
Choose the word: I ____ remember it clearly.
Choose the word: These shoes don't fit me ____.
Choose the word: You're ____ early!

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with even.

items.prompt: Add the missing word: She has visited 40 countries â€” ____ Japan.
Add the missing word: It's hot today, ____ in the shade.
Add the missing word: I couldn't open the jar, ____ with a tool.
Complete: Nobody called, not ____ my sister.
Complete: ____ my boss agreed with me.
Complete: He didn't apologise, not ____ once.

exercises.instruction: Put even in the correct position (before the main verb; after be/auxiliaries).

items.prompt: Complete: I have ____ seen that film twice.
Complete: She is ____ thinking about quitting.
Complete: They can ____ speak French.
Complete: He didn't ____ notice me.
Complete: We were ____ laughing at the joke.
Complete: I will ____ call you later.
Complete: She has ____ met the author.
Complete: They are ____ arguing again.
Complete: I don't ____ remember his name.

exercises.instruction: Use (not) even for emphasis.

items.prompt: Complete: I didn't get a reply, not ____ an email.
Complete: Not ____ the manager knew.
Complete: He can't swim, not ____ a little.
Complete: She didn't smile, not ____ once.
Complete: Not ____ a child could solve it.
Complete: They didn't help, not ____ with advice.

exercises.instruction: Complete with even to emphasise an unusual detail.

items.prompt: Complete: We have meetings every day, ____ on Saturdays sometimes.
Complete: I can read it ____ without my glasses.
Complete: She remembered ____ my birthday.
Complete: The signal is weak ____ inside the house.
Complete: He kept training ____ with an injury.
Complete: They sell coffee ____ at night.
Complete: He arrived on time, ____ in heavy traffic.
Complete: I felt nervous, ____ at home.
Complete: The app crashed ____ after the update.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with although / though / even though.

items.prompt: Choose the connector: ____ it was raining, we went for a walk.
Choose the connector: I stayed, ____ I was exhausted.
Choose the connector: ____ she is young, she is very experienced.
Choose the connector: He bought it, ____ it was expensive.
Choose the connector: ____ I don't like crowds, I went to the concert.
Choose the connector: We finished on time, ____ we started late.
Choose the connector: ____ he apologised, I still felt upset.
Choose the connector: I called you, ____ I knew you were busy.

exercises.instruction: Complete with despite or in spite of.

items.prompt: Complete with DESPITE or IN SPITE OF: ____ the rain, we played outside.
Complete with DESPITE or IN SPITE OF: ____ being tired, she kept studying.
Complete: ____ his injury, he ran the race.
Complete: ____ having no map, we found the place.
Complete: ____ the noise, I fell asleep.
Complete: ____ working late, he came to dinner.
Complete: ____ the cost, they bought the tickets.

exercises.instruction: Use although/though with a clause, or despite/in spite of (the fact that) for contrast.

items.prompt: Complete: ____ the fact that it was cold, we ate outside.
Complete: ____ the fact that he was new, he led the project.
Choose: ____ it was cold, we ate outside.
Choose: ____ he was new, he led the project.
Complete: ____ the fact that I was late, they waited.
Choose: ____ I was late, they waited.

exercises.instruction: Complete with though / even if / even though.

items.prompt: Complete: I like the job. It's stressful, ____.
Complete: We didn't win. We improved, ____.
Choose the phrase for a condition: I'll come, ____ it rains.
Choose the phrase for a fact: I came, ____ it was raining.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with in case.

items.prompt: Complete: Take some cash ____ the card machine doesn't work.
Complete: I saved her number ____ I needed it later.
Complete: Bring a jacket ____ it gets cold.
Complete: Write it down ____ you forget.
Complete: Keep the box ____ you want to return it.
Complete: I'll come early ____ there are delays.

exercises.instruction: Add just in case to make the precaution stronger.

items.prompt: Complete: I'll send you the file again, ____.
Complete: Let's take a photo of the ticket, ____.
Complete: I'll bring an umbrella, ____.
Complete: Keep my address saved, ____.

exercises.instruction: Choose if or in case.

items.prompt: Choose IF or IN CASE: ____ it rains, we'll cancel the picnic. (condition)
Choose IF or IN CASE: Take a raincoat ____ it rains. (precaution)
Choose IF or IN CASE: Call me ____ you're late. (condition)
Choose IF or IN CASE: Leave a note ____ I don't hear the phone. (precaution)
Choose IF or IN CASE: ____ you see Maya, tell her to call me. (condition)

exercises.instruction: Complete with in case of + noun.

items.prompt: Complete: ____ fire, do not use the lift.
Complete: ____ an emergency, call this number.
Complete: ____ delays, we'll text you.
Complete: ____ problems, contact support.
Complete: ____ loss of power, the system shuts down.
Complete: ____ bad weather, the event moves indoors.
Complete: ____ theft, report it immediately.
Complete: ____ damage, keep the packaging.
Complete: ____ illness, please stay home.
Complete: ____ a missed delivery, reschedule online.

exercises.instruction: Complete with unless (= if not).

items.prompt: Complete: I'll wait here ____ you tell me to leave.
Complete: ____ you hurry, you'll miss the bus.
Complete: We can't start ____ everyone arrives.
Complete: I won't buy it ____ it's cheaper.
Complete: Nobody gets in ____ they have a ticket.
Complete: The deal fails ____ both sides agree.

exercises.instruction: Complete with as long as / so long as / provided (that).

items.prompt: Choose: You can borrow my bike ____ you bring it back today.
Choose: I'll help you ____ you are honest.
Choose: You can stay here ____ you keep quiet.
Choose: We will refund you ____ you have the receipt.
Choose: You may use the room ____ you clean it after.

exercises.instruction: Use unless (= if not). In unreal situations with would, use if â€¦ not.

items.prompt: Rewrite using UNLESS (one word): If you don't book now, you won't get a seat.
Rewrite using UNLESS (one word): If you don't back up your data, you might lose it.
Choose IF (not unless): I would not go ____ I had to.
Choose IF: I wouldn't call him ____ it was urgent.
Rewrite using UNLESS (one word): If you don't sign here, the form is invalid.
Choose IF: I would be lost ____ I didn't have GPS.
Rewrite using UNLESS (one word): If you don't study, you'll fail the exam.
Choose IF: I wouldn't buy it ____ it was cheaper.
Rewrite using UNLESS (one word): If you don't wear a helmet, it's dangerous.
Choose IF: I'd stay home ____ I felt better.

exercises.instruction: Complete with unless / as long as / provided (that).

items.prompt: Choose: You can come ____ you finish your work first.
Choose: ____ you have an ID, you can enter.
Choose: I won't mention it ____ you ask me to.
Choose: We'll start at 7 ____ there are no problems.
Choose: Nobody leaves ____ the teacher says so.
Choose: I'll join you ____ you don't mind waiting.
Choose: You can keep the book ____ you return it next week.
Choose: We won't cancel ____ it gets dangerous.
Choose: We'll accept the offer ____ it includes delivery.

exercises.instruction: Choose as when two actions happen at the same time.

items.prompt: Choose AS or WHEN: ____ I was driving, I listened to music. (same time)
Choose: ____ the day went on, it got colder.
Choose: ____ she was speaking, I took notes.
Choose: ____ I cooked, the kids set the table.
Choose: ____ we walked, we talked about work.

exercises.instruction: Choose when if one thing happens after another.

items.prompt: Choose AS or WHEN: ____ I got home, I made dinner. (after)
Choose: ____ the meeting ended, we left.
Choose: ____ she arrived, we started.
Choose: ____ I finished the call, I sent an email.
Choose: ____ the bus came, we got on.

exercises.instruction: Complete with as meaning 'because'.

items.prompt: Complete with AS (= because): ____ it was late, we took a taxi.
Complete: ____ I was hungry, I ordered soup.
Complete: ____ the shop was closed, we went home.
Complete: ____ I don't drive, I took the train.
Complete: ____ we had no time, we skipped lunch.
Complete: ____ it was noisy, I left early.
Complete: ____ youâ€™re busy, Iâ€™ll call later.

exercises.instruction: Choose as or when.

items.prompt: Choose: ____ I was leaving, the phone rang. (same time)
Choose: ____ I left, the phone rang. (after)
Choose: ____ the weeks passed, I felt better.
Choose: ____ the class finished, everyone applauded.
Choose: ____ I saw the price, I changed my mind. (after)
Choose: ____ I looked closer, I noticed the mistake. (same time)
Choose: ____ it was snowing, we stayed inside. (because)
Choose: ____ I got the message, I replied. (after)

exercises.instruction: Complete with as meaning 'because'.

items.prompt: Choose AS (= because): ____ I was tired, I went to bed early.
Choose: ____ it was cheap, I bought it.
Choose: ____ the roads were icy, we drove slowly.
Choose: ____ I didn't know the answer, I asked.
Choose: ____ we were late, we skipped the intro.

exercises.instruction: Complete with as/like/such as and common expressions.

items.prompt: Choose AS or LIKE: Do it ____ I showed you. (clause)
Choose: I left everything ____ it was.
Choose: She spoke ____ she was sure.
Complete: You're late ____.
Complete: ____ , he complained first.
Complete: My phone is the same ____ yours.
Choose AS or LIKE: You should do it ____ this. (noun phrase)
Choose: I want a jacket ____ yours. (noun phrase)
Choose: We visited places ____ Rome and Florence. (examples)
Choose: I enjoy drinks ____ tea and coffee. (examples)

exercises.instruction: Complete with as in fixed expressions.

items.prompt: Complete: Your answer is the same ____ mine.
Complete: ____ you know, the meeting is cancelled.
Complete: ____ I said earlier, we need more time.
Complete: They did ____ they promised.
Complete: You can do ____ you like.
Complete: Leave it ____ it is.

exercises.instruction: Complete with like or such as.

items.prompt: Choose LIKE or SUCH AS: I need tools ____ a screwdriver and pliers.
Choose: I like cities ____ Barcelona.
Choose: We sell fruit ____ apples and pears.
Choose: Sports ____ cycling are popular here.
Choose: I avoid foods ____ peanuts.
Choose: Animals ____ dogs can be trained.
Choose: She loves languages ____ Spanish.
Choose: I bought snacks ____ chips and nuts.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with as / like / such as and related expressions.

items.prompt: Choose: She did it ____ I asked.
Choose: He looks ____ his father.
Complete: ____ you know, I don't drive.
Complete: It happened ____ I expected.
Complete: We met in a cafÃ© ____ the one near your house.
Complete: He arrived late ____.
Complete: My result is the same ____ yours.
Complete: Do ____ you like.
Choose: I enjoy hobbies ____ reading and chess.
Choose: We sell snacks ____ nuts and fruit.
Complete: ____ always, she stayed calm.
Choose: Fix it ____ I showed you.
Choose: Fix it ____ this.
Complete: They did ____ they promised.
Complete: Your model is the same ____ mine.
Complete: Cities ____ Kyiv are busy.

exercises.instruction: Complete with like / as if / as though after look/sound/seem.

items.prompt: Choose LIKE / AS IF / AS THOUGH: It looks ____ it's going to snow.
Choose: You sound ____ you need rest.
Choose: It seems ____ the bus is late.
Choose: It smells ____ something is burning.

exercises.instruction: Complete with like / as if / as though.

items.prompt: Complete: He spoke ____ he was in charge.
Complete: She ran ____ she was late for a flight.
Complete: They stared at me ____ I was crazy.
Complete: He acted ____ nothing had happened.
Complete: She smiled ____ she didn't care.
Complete: He walked away ____ he was angry.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct form after as if / as though (often past forms for an unreal present).

items.prompt: Choose the verb form: He talks as if he ____ everything. (present meaning)
Choose: She treats me as if I ____ a child. (unreal)
Choose: It looks as though it ____ broken.
Choose: He behaves as if he ____ the boss.
Choose: You speak as if you ____ there.
Choose: She looks as though she ____ ill.
Choose: He drives as if he ____ in a race.
Choose: They act as if they ____ nothing to lose.

exercises.instruction: Complete with were after as if (formal/unreal style).

items.prompt: Complete with WERE: He talks to me as if I ____ invisible.
Complete with WERE: She looked at me as if she ____ surprised.
Complete with WERE: It sounds as if it ____ impossible.
Complete with WERE: He acted as if he ____ innocent.

exercises.instruction: Complete with for to say how long something lasts.

items.prompt: Complete with FOR: We waited ____ two hours.
Complete: I lived there ____ three months.
Complete: She has been ill ____ a week.
Complete: They talked ____ a long time.
Complete: I haven't seen you ____ ages.
Complete: We stayed ____ the weekend.
Complete: He worked here ____ five years.
Complete: The lesson lasted ____ 45 minutes.
Complete: We drove ____ an hour.
Complete: She studied ____ two hours last night.
Complete: The call went on ____ ten minutes.
Complete: They were away ____ a month.

exercises.instruction: Complete with during to say when something happened within a period.

items.prompt: Complete with DURING: I fell asleep ____ the lecture.
Complete: Nobody spoke ____ the meeting.
Complete: The lights went out ____ the storm.
Complete: He checked his phone ____ the movie.
Complete: I heard a noise ____ the night.
Complete: She stayed quiet ____ the interview.
Complete: We met ____ my trip to Poland.
Complete: I learned a lot ____ the course.
Complete: The alarm rang ____ breakfast.
Complete: He got a call ____ class.
Complete: I hurt my knee ____ training.
Complete: We had a blackout ____ the match.

exercises.instruction: Complete with while to show two actions at the same time.

items.prompt: Complete with WHILE: I read ____ she cooked.
Complete: ____ I was waiting, I checked my email.
Complete: He called ____ I was driving.
Complete: She listened to music ____ she worked.
Complete: ____ we were having dinner, the doorbell rang.
Complete: The kids played ____ I cleaned the kitchen.
Complete: I saw him ____ I was walking home.
Complete: ____ you are here, can you help me?
Complete: He fell asleep ____ the TV was on.
Complete: ____ she was abroad, she learned Italian.

exercises.instruction: Choose for, during or while.

items.prompt: Choose FOR/DURING/WHILE: We waited ____ an hour. (duration)
Choose: I fell asleep ____ the film. (when)
Choose: I checked my phone ____ I was waiting. (simultaneous)
Choose: She was away ____ two weeks. (duration)
Choose: The power went out ____ the storm. (when)
Choose: He read ____ she watched TV. (simultaneous)
Choose: They talked ____ a long time. (duration)
Choose: I met him ____ my trip. (when)
Choose: ____ you were out, there was a call. (time)
Choose: We stayed there ____ the weekend. (duration)

exercises.instruction: Use by to mean 'not later than'.

items.prompt: Choose BY or UNTIL: Please reply ____ Friday. (deadline)
Choose: Be home ____ 7 p.m. (deadline)
Choose: The parcel should arrive ____ Monday.
Choose: Finish the report ____ noon.
Choose: She should be here ____ now.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable form after by the time.

items.prompt: Complete: By the time we arrived, the meeting ____ (start).
Complete: By the time you get home, I ____ (finish) dinner.
Complete: By the time she called, I ____ (leave).
Complete: By the time they wake up, we ____ (go).
Complete: By the time I reached the station, the train ____ (go).
Complete: By the time you read this, I ____ (send) it.
Complete: By the time he got there, the shop ____ (close).
Complete: By the time we finish, it ____ (be) dark.
Complete: By the time she arrived, everyone ____ (eat).
Complete: By the time I see you, I ____ (do) it.
Complete: By the time the film ended, we ____ (fall) asleep.
Complete: By the time you call, I ____ already ____ (leave).
Complete: By the time he apologised, I ____ (calm down).
Complete: By the time the taxi came, we ____ (wait) 20 minutes.

exercises.instruction: Choose by or until.

items.prompt: Choose BY or UNTIL: I'll wait ____ 5 o'clock. (continue)
Choose: I'll finish it ____ 5 o'clock. (deadline)
Choose: He will be away ____ Monday. (continue)
Choose: He will be back ____ Monday. (deadline)
Choose: We stayed open ____ midnight. (continue)
Choose: We'll have the results ____ next week. (deadline)
Choose: I won't speak to him ____ he apologises. (continue)

exercises.instruction: Complete using by / by the time / until.

items.prompt: Choose: Iâ€™ll be working ____ 6, then Iâ€™ll go home.
Choose: Please send it ____ tomorrow morning.
Complete: ____ the time you arrive, I'll be asleep.
Choose: She stayed there ____ the end of the talk.
Choose: They should finish ____ Friday.
